Among veterans nationally, the rate is 15 percent overall and 20 percent for younger veterans who've served less than five years, Kirsten Gillibrand said. For the men and women who literally risked their lives, giving everything of themselves to defend our country and our freedom, I think going that extra mile really does matter. And I think we should because their unemployment is that much greater, Kirsten Gillibrand said. U.S. Senator Kirsten Gillibrand spoke during a roundtable discussion about the employment future of military veterans held at the Southside Innovation Center. American Idol's season-one co-host Brian Dunkleman admits to having been extremely freaked out the first time he saw Simon Cowell tell someone they should never sing again. It's one thing to watch it on television, but then you spend time with these kids and you have to look at them right in the eyes, and then their mother is looking at you, like,` What just happened?'?
